subclassFeature.name: Sons of The Lupercal Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Lupercal are considered the first and foremost amongst their many kin. They are a formidable force that often form the tip of the spear for a attacking army, poised to drive deep into the enemy's throat and cut off their head in a swift and decisive move.

subclassFeature.name: Adaptable
entries: When you take this archetype at 3rd level you gain two extra skill proficiencies from the list of skills presented under class features, or you may choose one of your skill proficiencies; your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen proficiency.

subclassFeature.name: Pile In!
entries: At 7th level you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with melee weapons against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Merciless Fighter
entries: At 10th level you can use your bonus action to make a single unarmed strike.

Additionally at the end of a creature within your reach's turn, you can use your reaction to make a single unarmed strike against that creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Close Combat
entries: At 15th level being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
Additionally when you use the Attack action and attack with a one-handed weapon, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one-handed ranged weapon you are holding.

subclassFeature.name: Bone Breaker
entries: Starting at 18th level when you score a critical hit with a melee attack you may attempt to cripple your foe. The creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier or be incapacitated, have their movement reduced to 5 ft. and be knocked prone. This effect remains until they are healed by a spell such as greater restoration.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of The Word Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Word are fanatics and zealots, contrary to the other Sons who are largely secular the Sons of the Word embrace the polar extremes of faith with fervour, channelling their devotion into every action.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Devotion
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level you gain a holy symbol of either a lawful good deity or a chaotic evil deity (your choice). You also gain proficiency in the Persuasion and Religion skills.

subclassFeature.name: Banishment
entries: At 7th level when you successfully hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a simple weapon that deals bludgeoning damage or a morningstar, you can try to push the creature back. The creature makes a Strength saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier, on a failed save the creature is pushed 15 feet away from you and knocked prone.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 1). You regain any expended uses of this feature once you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Crusader
entries: At 10th level you gain a number of zeal dice equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), which are d4s. You can roll a die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, damage roll, or saving throw you make.

Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against you, you can use your reaction to roll the Zeal die and add the number rolled to your AC against that attack, after seeing the roll but before knowing whether it hits or misses.
A zeal die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended zeal dice when you finish a long rest. At 18th level your Zeal dice are now d6s.

subclassFeature.name: Undaunted
entries: At 15th level your tenacity and fervent faith spreads to others, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be frightened while you are conscious.

subclassFeature.name: The Power of Faith
entries: At 18th level you can use you action to pray to your deity for help. On your turn roll a d20 and add your Charisma modifier against a DC equal to your Charisma score.

On a success you add your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) to either: your AC and saving throws if the deity you chose is lawful good or your attack and damage rolls if the deity you chose is chaotic evil.
You need to finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of The Drake Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Drake are master craftsmen who claim their lineage descends from the dragons themselves. They focus on who they can save before what they can fight and are generally held in high regard for their consideration towards common-folk during conflicts.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Bloodline
entries: At 3rd level you can speak, read and write Draconic, you gain resistance to Fire damage and weapons that cause Fire damage do twice as much Fire damage when wielded by you.

subclassFeature.name: Hammer and Anvil
entries: At 7th level if you are attacking an enemy with a warhammer or maul when they are flanked by a wall or one of your allies with a shield the weapon damage you roll is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Helping Hand
entries: At 10th level if you use the Help action to aid an ally's melee attack while you're wielding a warhammer or maul, you knock the target's defence aside momentarily. In addition to the ally gaining advantage on the attack roll, the ally gains a +2 bonus to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Forgemaster
entries: Starting at 15th level your knowledge with the forge and the arts of smithing allow you to upgrade your weapons and armor to be more effective.

For each level you want to upgrade the weapon the process takes 3 hours and costs five times the item's value in gold. The cost represents the materials required to improve the weapon; for each level of upgrade a weapon gains a +1 to its attack and damage rolls or a piece of armour gains +1 to its AC.
The maximum number of levels you can upgrade a weapon is 2; at 18th level the maximum increases to 3.

subclassFeature.name: Forgemaster
entries: At 18th level the maximum number of levels you can upgrade a weapon with your Forgemaster feature increases to 3.

subclassFeature.name: The Unbound Flame
entries: Starting at 18th level you can use your bonus action to ignite a melee weapon you are holding, once ignited it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage for 1 minute and is considered a magic weapon.

Creatures hit by your weapon while this feature is active must succeed a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Constitution modifier at the start of their next turn or take an additional 2d4 fire damage.
You regain the use of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of The Raven Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Raven are dark mannered and brooding, their sombre nature belying their true power. Masters of fast, harrowing attacks that are over as swiftly as they begin, leaving only death behind.

entries.subclassFeature: Hit and Run|Fighter||Sons of The Raven|FFHorusHeresyMartialArchetypes|3

subclassFeature.name: Hit and Run
entries: At 3rd level you've learnt how to use quick retreats between your attacks to avoid danger. You may disengage as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Silence
entries: At 7th level you gain proficiency in the Stealth skill and armour no longer imposes disadvantage to Stealth checks.

subclassFeature.name: Death By A Thousand Cuts
entries: Starting at 10th level, while you are wielding a separate melee weapon with the light property in each hand you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls with those weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Untouchable
entries: Starting at 15th level you are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't incapacitated and are aware of the attacker.

subclassFeature.name: Nevermore
entries: When you reach 18th level you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, if you have advantage on your first attack roll using a weapon with the light property, you can deal three times the damage rolled; this only applies to your first attack and not any subsequent attacks on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of The Hydra Martial Archetype
entries: Little is known about the Sons of The Hydra, rumours persist that there is only one in existance at any time, despite tales to the contrary, undoubtedly they indulge in deception and subterfuge on a machiavellian scale.

entries.subclassFeature: The Many Heads of The Hydra|Fighter||Sons of The Hydra|FFHorusHeresyMartialArchetypes|3

subclassFeature.name: The Many Heads of The Hydra
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level you always, whenever you're asked your name by someone whom you do not trust, simply reply: "I am one of many." or some other thematic variation there upon. Your true name is kept secret or is simply forgotten.
You gain proficiency in the Deception skill, disguise kits, and forgery kits. Additionally you have advantage on rolls to disguise yourself as someone of the same race.

subclassFeature.name: Mutable Tactics
entries: At 7th level you may choose one bonus from the following list:
You may dash as a bonus action.
You may disengage as a bonus action.
You gain proficiency in the Stealth skill or your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make if you are already proficient.
You may use your reaction to make an attack against a creature that enters your reach.
You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with melee weapons you are proficient with.
You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with range weapons you are proficient with.
You gain +2 to Initiative rolls.
Moving through non-magical difficult terrain does not cost extra feet of movement.
You gain proficiency in Dexterity saving throws.
You gain proficiency in Intelligence saving throws.
You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.
You gain proficiency in Charisma saving throws.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make in one skill you have proficiency in.
You gain a new skill from those listed in the class features.
You may change your selection when you finish a long rest.
At 15th level you may choose a second bonus from the list, you may not choose the same bonus more than once.

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Improvisation
entries: At 10th level you become proficient with Improvised Weapons and can use your bonus action to grapple a target hit with an improvised weapon or unarmed attack.

subclassFeature.name: Mutable Tactics
entries: At 15th level you may choose a second bonus from the list in your Mutable Tactics feature; you may not choose the same bonus more than once.

subclassFeature.name: Sever One Head...
entries: Starting at 15th level when you take damage you can use your reaction to cast mirror image. Whilst the spell is active you gain a +1 bonus to your damage rolls for every duplicate you have remaining.
You regain the use of this feature once you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blood of The Primogenitor
entries: Starting at 18th level you can use your action to unleash the Blood of The Primogenitor. For 1 minute you gain a +2 bonus to your Strength and Constitution scores, you can make a single additional attack on your turn as a bonus action, and your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. Any hitpoints gained by the increase to your Constitution modifier are added to your temporary hitpoints rather than your hitpoint maximum.
You regain the use of this feature once you finish a long rest.
